title: Intelsat meets conditions for $3.7 billion C-band clearing payout
summary: Intelsat said Aug. 14 it is due for a $3.7 billion windfall late this year after becoming the latest satellite operator to clear C-band spectrum ahead of schedule for terrestrial 5G telcos in the United States.

title: NASA Announces Launch Service for Arctic Warming Experiment
summary: NASA has selected Rocket Lab USA Inc. of Long Beach, California, to provide the launch service for the agency’s PREFIRE (Polar Radiant Energy in the Far-InfraRed Experiment) mission, which aims to give researchers a more accurate picture of the energy entering and leaving Earth.

title: Space Force pitch to private sector: ‘Help us with space protection’
summary: Companies that can contribute innovations in threat identification, space awareness, on-orbit mobility and other areas related to space protection are being urged to participate in the next Hyperspace Challenge scheduled for this fall.

title: Julio de 2023 fue el mes más caluroso registrado
summary: Según los investigadores del Instituto Goddard de Estudios Espaciales (GISS, por sus siglas en inglés) de la NASA, en Nueva York, julio de 2023 fue el mes más caluroso de todos los que se han registrado en el registro de temperaturas mundiales.

title: NASA Clocks July 2023 as Hottest Month on Record Ever Since 1880
summary: According to scientists at NASA’s Goddard Institute for Space Studies (GISS) in New York, July 2023 was hotter than any other month in the global temperature record.

title: Earth observation evolution: Bigger satellites promise bigger payoff for imagery operators
summary: More cost-effective satellites on the larger Rideshare strains end of the smallsat scale are opening up new capabilities for the Earth observation industry. New sensors and improved performance promise to attract a greater variety of customers to the market.

title: 2023 Small Satellite Conference Dailies Wrap up
summary: The SpaceNews editorial team produced three show dailies for the 2023 Small Satellite show during the 2023 Small Satellite show in Logan, Utah, the week of Aug. 7. Download the entire three […]

title: China launches first geosynchronous orbit radar satellite
summary: China launched what is thought to be the world’s first geosynchronous orbit synthetic aperture radar satellite on Saturday.

title: Rocket Lab sees Virgin Orbit facility as “scaling enabler” for Neutron
summary: Rocket Lab says a Virgin Orbit facility it acquired at a bankruptcy auction in May will allow the company to scale up production of its Neutron rocket in development.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy August 13-19, 2023
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of August 13-19, 2023 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in recess […]
